summary:
In 1938, Germany, Britain, France, and Italy agreed to let Germany take over a part of Czechoslovakia called the Sudetenland. This area had many ethnic Germans living there. The deal was made to avoid a big war, but it didn't work. Soon after, Germany took over the rest of Czechoslovakia, breaking its promise.

This event is now seen as a mistake, as it encouraged Hitler's aggression. The term "Munich Agreement" is now used to show what happens when you try to make peace with countries that don't keep their word.
title: Munich Agreement
